title: ICT Research to Support Freight and Logistics
segmentation: As well as already mentioned, we are the Titleist energy efficiency and sustainable logistics.
And now that we have covered to some extent the IT sector, I'm very happy that we have Peters unarmed here from DHL.
One of the world.
One of the biggest.
Logistics providers you tell us.
Who will give her, let's say, a man more detailed inside into energy efficiency and the interesting thing was Peters that he's actually in charge in the company for for environmental policy.
And so I'm very anxious to see what you are presented on what you could present us there.
Yes gladly.
Thank you.
Yes, for the introduction get more ladies and gentlemen.
Alright, my watch tells me correctly.
There's 3 minutes to your coffee break with your indulgence.
Mr chairman.

Dear audience, I would cut slightly into that, but I'll promise to try my very best not to make it too hard on you now when I was invited to speak at this conference in the first session is obviously that I've been given the task that Sen. She make a broad sweep over the strategic importance of ITSI with regard to status.
Anable logistics and transportation.

And as we've already heard from Wolfgang, the European Commission has a rather colorful set of policies in place that calls for exactly that efficient transportation efficient logistics, competitive mobility in the interurban and the urban domain, a sustainable transportation with regard to environmental impacts, and of course it also gives ICT.
Role in facilitating these very ambitious targets.
From the perspective of.
Sustainability as we define it at the DHL Deutsche Post.
DHL as is the new name since a couple of months.
There are two sides.

One's economic side, the other is the environmental side on the economic side, we know that logistics is one of the main contributors to economic prosperity, and you see some of the figures that we've seen that in the wake of globalization of manufacturing and trade, there's been a surge and transportation dim and logistics providers such as DP, DHL.
In our competitors, we do our very best to map that efficiently into physical transportation together with our son.

Contractors and despite the slum that we faced obviously in the current year we would face that for the future efficient logistics networks and that goes for mobility of people as well As for goods will be a prerequisite for the globe and SoC to work.
And EPD Edgell plays a pretty important role in there and like said by Enza, we may be number one or somewhere among the top dogs, but it is a hugely fragmented market.
Which has its own implications with regard to coordination and control, and I'll come back to that later and also to the obvious role that I TS will play in there.
We look at the other side of the metal.
Unfortunately, there's a downturn to the economic prosperity that we've seen, and globalization is a humongous increase in the combustion of energy sources.
Larger coming from fossil fuel sources, and that, of course, releases enormous amounts of climate change greenhouse gases into the atmosphere.
And we know there's a huge discussion.
There is a pre lude to the COP 15 conference next month in Copenhagen, or hopefully.
Some sort of successive document to the Kyoto Protocol will be rectified, which will expire in 2012.

As we know there is an issue with release of greenhouse gases from the use of fossil energy sources in the wake of industrialization and globalization, we know from the IPCC studies in the United Nations, in fact, that there needs to be a peak latest by 2015 and then a sharp decrease.
Of release of greenhouse gases.

In order to at least limit the increase of the average temperature to 2 degrees cause beyond two degrees, there is a very likelihood that we get a runaway you facts and then we won't stop at three or four degrees it will go through with the five or six with dire consequences for the way on lifestyle that we have today and you see some of the indications are right now.
The average emission by person and in year.
On the global level is 11 tons.
China's foreign growing rapidly and to the USS 20 in Australia I think 2224 and needs to go down to two.

In order to realize that and that means some very drastic issues regarding the efficiency of the current structures and operations, but also to the structures and operations and the general concepts of manufacturing and trade as we see them today.
DP DHL has its own Go green program in that context that we've committed publicly.
Two efficiency improvements, which means reduction of carbon emissions per activity.
This also goes hand in hand with reductions of emissions at local level, particulate snax noise, etc.
So can ICT help?
To bring together those two worlds of the economy and the environment.
We certainly see that there is a number of examples on the whole or can say as ICT can do that.
Well, it's not a silver bullet.
What do you mean with that?
ICT obviously needs a physical framework to work within organizational framework at that it needs logistics concepts can latch to it is not the self standing solution.
It is an enabler and we must not forget that these things need to go hand in hand.
ICT already features as a mainstream background system.
We have hardly any vehicles today that will work without ICT.
We have hardly any equipment that will work without ICT or warehouse will not work without ICT.
Track and trace in order management and anything that runs on a computer.
Very obviously cannot run without ICT and that is general purpose applications very generic that are being translated into logistics applications and these will certainly move on.
But then there's some icing.
If I would say on the cake in terms of specific new opportunities at ICT can open and that is essentially where we embark on the area of pre competitive and industrial research.
In ICT in the next.
So 5 minutes.
Hope I'm just giving you a go.

Drones at some of the issues, starting with very specific and nuts and bolts applications all the way up to conceptual work and overtime you will see at the bottom some of the relevant projects or some at least of them and begging your pardon and leeways if I've I've overlooked any relevant projects in that context, it certainly was not on purpose.
Starting Eco driving assistance.
How can we get drivers?

To actually run the vehicles properly, and there's certainly issues where you can achieve energy efficiency improvements with driver training, but that has to be recurrent, so you have to retrain people every six months.

Much better if you have an in cap system that is directly into relating with the driver and maybe do some benchmarking within a small cartoon because you also want to protect the confidentiality and individual T one of the driver you don't blare out.
Everything to management.

Sometimes you're even forbidden by the workers councils to do that, but if you have a straight and direct interaction between the driver and is a vehicles and within the driver platoon you can incentivize drivers to do that same thing that you can switch on optional operations modes of vehicles when they enter into sensitive zones and when they get out there they get to fully perform mode again when they for instance have to enter highway.
Dynamic routing.
In guidance, one of the bread and butter things at logistics providers and whole user doing is to improve the circulation of the Villa.
And using the best driver time on them.
And.
Currently the very powerful algorithms that we're using for that they suffer a bit from the quality of the base data.
Very often it is a static St network that is at the foundation of it.
Much better if we were to have a statistical imprint of recurrent traffic patterns, so you don't want to use a particular through fair at 8:00 or 8:30 in the morning when everyone does it.
So you just reroute the vehicle so it comes a bit earlier or bit later depending on the availability of the actual receiver.
And if you do spot delivery, that means a time definite express delivery that you paid to get there within the hour.
Then you can do some dynamic rerouting and we're just testing that on two vehicles in Berlin with quite some success.

And also I city can have a role in monitoring outside goods, dangerous goods, user sensitive infrastructure that very much connects then with infrastructure access and transit management, especially in the urban domain.
That is a very important role because they're afraid doesn't really have access to a dedicated infrastructure.
If you have a collective transportation of good air of people.
Bus, Metro, whatever.
They usually have their own infrastructure.
Freight has to use a shared infrastructure with everyone else, but it needs some particular aspects such as loading zones etc.
And we trial very successfully in Bremen in a project called Perfume Loading Zone that is exclusively reserved to designated vehicles which meet the highest standards for low emissions.
Actually, it's EV vehicles which are very, very low.
Emissions.
Then the intelligent cargo that is another interesting idea with the, let's say, onset of.
Radio frequency identification.

Obviously when I show you, here is an example from DHL where we use a connection between RFID chip and the temperature sensor to go down to item level, so that's more card that you see on the left hand site.

It's actually placed with the items or small packages with several items and will without having to re open the packaging again allow you to track whether or not there's been a breach in temperature control.
This is an existing.
Industrial system and of course we had.
Projects like partial: ongoing project, Urechi look into these issues.
Very important aspect here though is that you have to have the right intelligence at the right level.
You don't need to have the all powerful small package to do all the very important things that that might have to be done alone.
Logistics shame what you need is a clever hierarchy of communication across different levels.
And that means we immediately come to exactly that point.
How to map and how to exchange seamlessly?
Dependable data between different layers in a very fragmented, very shared work space type environment that is logistics nowadays.
Specially on transcontinental links with the pre and on carriage we have a number of projects that look into these issues.
The hierarchies may not just be on an organizational level that can be on a modal level as well, it can be on the physical level.
They certainly are on geographical level and these certainly need to be brought together.
It's not just precompetitive research looking into that and.
Now the computer was locked for a time, sorry.
There's also industry initiatives going on in that context, and obviously you could hold one or two extra conferences looking into industrial research.
That follows similar lines that does pre competitive racer.
So just picked one that's yet to Z Freight.
So yeah, is the airline Association.
DHL is a partner through its own aviation line.
In 2004, yet to members concerns came together and they committed to replace paper work.
That follows or accompanies the flow of goods in airfreight by electronic messaging and the first pilot ran in 2007.
As you see, by October 2009, that's the latest figures.
21 countries participating.
Nearly 100 airports more than 20 airlines over well over 100 forwarders, so this is a huge impact in the industry.
A very collateral effect that this single project is taking.
And if you look at.
The coverage.
Next year, the plan is to cover about to have removed about 2/3 of the very fragmented paperwork with the unified electronic messaging service.
And that is a huge impact that has sensually being put in place since 2004.
Physically since 2007.
What does this?
Tell us if we look back at the very ambitious targets from the policy agenda.

We certainly need synchronization between the pre competitive and in the industrial research to meet these targets, and we look specifically at the precompetitive research or a certain issues that need to be looked at time to market.
If you remember at the intelligent cargo slight, there was a project named Parcel called Thinking Tags.
They called it.
They run a lot of pilots that look pretty familiar to lot of this stuff that we see today in 2009.
But that pilot ran in 2001.
And the question is then, how do we bring incremental advancements from the projects with better penetration into the market?
That's certainly to me needs to be brought out much more clearly to the perspective users.
Much like Wolfgang was saying earlier and also needs to be the deployment needs to be a governance process in my view.
So stakeholders need to be brought together and expect Lee especially happy that we've run out with the logistics for Life Project to actually be part in that process.
The Safety Forum certainly is another one.
The ICT for energy efficiency form that is currently being firm could be another group that could look specifically into diploid magicians.
And of course it can only D ploy, but you know about so targeted communication to the actual anticipated users.
Everyone in this room who's involved mostly since years, and so sometimes several decades even in precompetitive research on ICT on logistics and transportation.
You know, we know that these things are going on and what they might hold in store.
But believe me, most of the industry out there has never held any deals and specially esimees with these things they don't.
So with particular these things in mind, I'm very much looking forward to the specific presentations that will be given by the various projects represented here today.
And thank you for your attention and.
Hope you enjoy the coffee.

Yeah, thank you very much Peter and I think you've done a very good Rep and I think it's also interesting that industry is looking at the project and trying to really nothing to really kind of focus and follow up on the on the developments there, and I'm particularly happy that we had you here because I think the topic that you are covering in DHL is a quite important one.
And obviously I mean optimizing transport at the same time means optimizing the environment environmental impact in most cases.
For the time being, yes.
